tutorial: Testing a Trading Idea - The Trigger Stage

definition.text: Superalgos strives to keep things simple, and so should you, as it is the best way to handle mounting complexity!

paragraphs.text: Conditions should be as granular as possible because:
It makes it easier to debug the syntax: when you pile up logic in a single condition, it's hard to find bugs you may have introduced.
It makes it easier to debug the strategy: if you keep logic segregated in different conditions, you will then be able to see precisely what part of the logic validates true or false.
It makes the strategy easier to maintain and upgrade: granular conditions make everything easier to undertand and follow.
